metadata.title: La industria del ladrillo y la urbanización de San Cristóbal, 1910-1940
metadata.journal_or_publisher: Anuario Colombiano de Historia Social y de la Cultura

relevance.topic: The relationship between the brick industry and urbanization in Bogotá
relevance.relevance: The study is relevant as it examines the impact of technological advancements in brick production on labor and urbanization in Bogotá, highlighting the coexistence of modern and artisanal production methods.

design.sample_characteristics: Focus on the southeastern sector of Bogotá, specifically San Cristóbal, during the early 20th century.

key_themes: coexistence of modern and artisanal production
urbanization driven by industrial and artisanal brick production
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes the historical development of the brick industry in San Cristóbal, highlighting the coexistence of modern factories and artisanal production, and their impact on urbanization.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of urban growth in Bogotá during the early 20th century.
historical_context.institutional_context: Limited state intervention in urban planning, with private urban developers leading the process.

outcomes.main_findings: The brick industry, both modern and artisanal, played a significant role in the urbanization of San Cristóbal, contributing to the development of worker neighborhoods.
outcomes.conclusions: The study concludes that the brick industry was crucial in shaping the urban landscape of southeastern Bogotá, with modern factories and artisanal production coexisting and influencing urban growth.
